channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Christophe de Menil, Art Patron and Designer, Is Dead at 92
item.description: A Parisian-born oil heiress, she collected art and supported major artists, designed costumes and moved in rarefied social and cultural circles.

item.title: What to Know About Al Jazeera, the Broadcaster Israel Accuses of Supporting Hamas
item.description: Al Jazeera, five of whose reporters the broadcaster said were killed by an Israeli strike, has angered governments across the region that claim it giv...

item.title: When the next recession hits, whoever is president will face intense pressure to cut tariffs, so don’t rely on them for revenue, top economist says
item.description: “There’s going to be a strong incentive on that president’s part to say, ‘Okay, I’m going to cut the taxes.’”

item.title: Adidas Apologizes After Mexico Criticizes Oaxacan-Inspired Shoe
item.description: Willy Chavarria, the designer of the shoe, also apologized after Mexican officials leveled accusations of cultural appropriation.

item.title: At Least One Dead in U.S. Steel Plant Explosion in Pennsylvania, Authorities Say
item.description: Ten people were hospitalized and one was missing after the blast at a coke plant in Clairton, Pa., near Pittsburgh, rescue workers said.

item.title: Trump extends China tariff truce by another 90 days, pushing new deadline to November
item.description: For now, the extension of a truce means that US tariffs on Chinese goods this year stand at 30%.

item.title: AI talent comes at a 30% salary premium: ‘If you try to play catch up later, this is going to cost you even more’
item.description: No longer are AI skills only associated with tech or IT roles.

item.title: Israel-Qatar Tensions Escalate After Israel Kills Al Jazeera Journalists
item.description: Israel and Qatar, which backs Al Jazeera and has hosted Hamas leaders, have long had a relationship marked by both public hostility and quiet collabor...

item.title: Exclusive: Fintech giant Stripe building ‘Tempo’ blockchain with crypto VC Paradigm
item.description: Stripe’s newest push into crypto comes as the company has made an aggressive push into stablecoins.

item.title: Are U.S. stock markets ‘whistling past the graveyard’? Stifel takes a close look at the great American ‘money illusion’
item.description: With the American consumer running out of breath amid an economic slowdown in the second half of 2025, Stifel sees a selloff of 10% or more in the S&P...

item.title: Israel’s Plan for Gaza City Is Still Unclear
item.description: There have been vague statements by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, but there is little clarity over the operation.

item.title: Brazil Clamped Down on Big Tech. Trump’s Tariffs Could Change That.
item.description: With President Trump on their side, U.S. technology companies now have more leverage in Brazil, where they seek to influence new rules policing their ...
